1.content:
Appalachian Mountains
Southern West Virginia

Olivia Sheppard stepped out onto a rock outcropping, overlooking a heavily forested section of the mountains. A noise from behind her caught her attention; looking back she saw her boyfriend, Kyle, struggling to put the tent back into its bag. Her two best friends Melissa and Liz were chatting about something nearby.

It was 2 weeks before Olivia and her friends were due to start their Senior year of High School. To mark the occasion, they each convinced their families to let them hike a part of the Appalachian trail. The group was 3 days into their planned 7-day excursion; having hiked just over 75 miles.

Taking one last look at the scenery, Olivia marched back to help Kyle with the tent. “Seriously babe, it’s not that hard to roll up the tent and place it inside the pack.”

“Yeah, well I’m doing the best I can.” Making his voice a little louder, Kyle said, “Especially when no one else is helping me.”

That remark caught the attention of Melissa and Liz, who quickly made their way back to the group. “Sorry,” with a wince, Melissa said, “We were discussing our plans for today.”

As everyone got to work with the tent, Olivia said, “So what is the plan for today?”

Looking up from her work, Liz said, “There’s a cave system nearby; I thought it would be cool to explore it.”

The idea of exploring a cave system did sound interesting; until Olivia realized that they didn’t have the equipment for it. “I don’t think that’s smart; it’s not like we have rock climbing equipment or anything.”

“Come on, I think we need to add some excitement to this hike.”

Kyle and Olivia exchanged looks with each other; before Olivia turned and looked back at Liz. “We spent two hours yesterday jumping off a waterfall; was that not exciting enough for you?”

Liz realized the position she’d just gotten herself into, “Yeah, that was exciting; but, come on, the idea of exploring caves doesn’t excite you guys?”

Olivia looked at Melissa and Kyle, the three of them quickly realizing Liz wasn’t going to let up. Melissa and Kyle both shrugged while Olivia turned back to Liz. “Okay fine; but if anything happens, we’re blaming you.”

*********************************


It took 10 minutes to get the tent squared away, and another 25 minutes to reach Liz’s caves. The girls waited outside as Kyle ventured inside to make sure it was safe. While they waited, Liz approached Olivia and said, “So how are things between you and Kyle?”

It took a moment for Olivia to register what Liz was talking about; a few days before the hike, she’d gotten into a fight with Kyle. It seemed that he wanted to take their relationship to the next level, but Olivia wasn’t sure she was ready for that yet. “I guess things are better; he’s brought it up a few times since we started, but eventually he lets it go.”

“I don’t mean to pry or anything; but is there a reason you don’t want to...you know.”

Olivia’s face turned sour for a moment as she turned to Liz. “I love Kyle; but I’m not sure he’s the one I want to lose my virginity to.” Looking around the area, Olivia said, “I know it sounds corny, but I can’t help but think my soul mate is out there somewhere.”

“Take it from me, girl; don’t give yourself to the wrong person.” Sighing, wiping a lone tear from her face, Liz said, “I slept with Emilia; the next thing I know she’s ghosting me.”

Hearing Liz mention her ex made Olivia sad; as they'd dated for over a year. They seemed like a great couple, until they took the next step after their Junior Prom. One-minute Liz was on cloud nine with her girlfriend, the next her now ex-girlfriend announces she’s moving and refuses to communicate with Liz. “You still haven’t heard from her?”

“Nope.” Sitting on a rock, Liz said, “I don’t get it; I thought we loved each other.”

Taking a seat next to her friend, Olivia said, “Love can make people do strange things; Emilia was probably scared.”

That conversation continued for a few minutes until Kyle came out of the cave entrance. Sitting nearby, Melissa said, “Is it safe?”

“Yeah, it’s safe.” Looking perplexed, Kyle said, “But there’s something inside I think you should all see.”

The group followed Kyle through the cave’s meandering interior for a few minutes until they came across a small cavern. The cavern itself was rather uninteresting, a few rock outcroppings here and there. What drew everyone’s attention was a clearly alien device in the middle – what looked like an old console connected to a vertical cylinder. As she approached it, Olivia said, “What is it?”

“I haven’t the foggiest idea, O.” coming up beside her, Kyle said, “Whatever it is, it’s definitely not from around here.”

Looking closer at the machine, Olivia quickly realized that it was incredibly old, telling by the plant life that had grown over a part of the console. What appeared to be alien writing was barely visible. Reaching out, Olivia touched a button and jumped back as the cylinder opened nearby.

As she started to step closer to it, Kyle and the others tried to stop her. “Olivia, I’m not sure that’s a smart idea.”

Ignoring her friends, Olivia stepped inside the cylinder only for it to close around her. Spinning around, looking scared, Olivia started pounding on the glass. “Guys, get me out of here.”

While Kyle went to try and break the glass, Liz and Melissa focused on the console. After a few moments, Liz noticed the lights on the console changing. As a whirring sound started to fill the room, Liz said, “Hey guys, I think it’s counting down to something.”

A bright light started to fill the cylinder as Olivia’s panicked screams could be heard over the noise. The others stepped back as sparks started flying around them; watching in stunned horror as the machine suddenly exploded. As the smoke cleared, they could see the device was destroyed; the only thing left was the charred remains of the console and some pieces of glass.

As they stepped closer, Liz saw something underneath a nearby panel – what looked like a human hand. Rushing towards it, Liz said, “Guys, it’s Olivia!”

Melissa and Kyle ran over; only to stop in their tracks when Liz lifted the panel to find all that remained of Olivia was her severed arm.
1.title: A Fateful Hike

11.content:
No one said a single word for what seemed like an eternity; until Melissa finally said, “Oh my God! Oh my God!”

That was followed by Melissa throwing up behind a rock while Liz struggled to keep from doing the same. While holding Melissa’s hair back, Liz looked at Kyle and said, “What are we supposed to do now?”

“I don’t know!” fixating on his girlfriend’s severed arm, Kyle said, “I can’t believe that just happened!”

Regaining some composure, Melissa wiped her mouth with her arm, “We have to call the cops.”

“And what exactly would we tell them?” pacing around in a circle, Kyle said, “That some strange machine we found exploded with Olivia inside it?”

“Mel’s right, we have to do something!”

“Don’t you think I know that!” focusing on Liz, Kyle said, “Just give me a minute to think, alright!”

The group decided it was best to leave the cave while Kyle tried to decide their next course of action. After a brief period, Kyle walked over and joined the girls by a tree. “So, here’s the plan; we’ll call Olivia’s parents and tell them there was an accident.”
Covering his mouth, Kyle said, “Once that’s over with, we’ll call the authorities.”

Getting to her feet, Melissa looked at Kyle and said, “I can tell her folks if you want.”

Struggling to keep composure, Kyle shook his head and said, “I was her boyfriend, so it’s my responsibility.”

As Kyle walked off to get some privacy, Melissa yelled out, “Holler if you need us!”

Kyle walked for about 50 feet until he could barely see the cave or the others. Sitting on a downed tree, he dug out his phone and dialed Oliva’s house. It was 10:00 on a Saturday morning; so, he knew her family would be home. Olivia’s brother Eric answered after a few rings, “Hey Kyle, what’s up? I thought we weren’t going to hear from you guys until tonight.”

Although Kyle was 2 years older than Eric, the two of them managed to get along. “Hey man; I-I need to talk with your folks.”
Sensing the tone of Kyle’s voice, Eric said, “Is something wrong?”

Tears starting to stream down his face, Kyle said, “Just get your folks, okay?”

Kyle listened as Eric put the phone down; he could hear Eric’s voice in the distance as he called out for his folks. After what seemed like an eternity, Olivia’s dad picked up, “Kyle? Is everything alright?”

Kyle stared up into the trees for a moment, trying to figure out what he was going to say next. “N-No, Mr. Sheppard; everything’s not alright.” Sniffling, Kyle said, “We were exploring this cave near where we spent the night when there was an accident. Olivia...she’s dead.”

There was silence on the other end for a moment, until Mr. Sheppard finally said, “What?”

Barely managing to keep it together at this point, Kyle said, “There was an accident in the cave; I’m not sure exactly what happened.” Pausing to wipe his face, Kyle said, “One minute she’s fine; the next minute all that’s left is her arm.”
11.title: The Aftermath

111.content:
Things moved remarkably fast after those phone calls had been made; the cops arrived via helicopter within 20 minutes to cordon off the area. The feds were called in once the machine had been discovered. They took over once that happened and kindly requested that everyone left the area.

Only once everyone was back at the station did the Kyle and girls give statements. If the police had any suspicions that the group was withholding information, they didn’t mention it. Eventually Olivia’s family arrived in town; where everyone, including the police, expressed their condolences.

Southern Pennsylvania
One Week Later

Olivia’s family took a week to make all the arrangements; interspersed with the obligatory expressing of condolences by friends and family. The service itself was private; with Kyle, Melissa and Liz being the only non-family in attendance.

Everyone was standing around the cemetery plot as they waited for the priest to arrive from the church. Walking up to Kyle, affectionately taking his hand in hers, Melissa said, “How are you doing?”

“About as well as can be expected, under the circumstances.” Looking over towards Eric, Kyle said, “I’m worried about Eric though; he’s hardly said a word to anyone in 5 days.”

Melissa had noticed that as well; that Eric had basically shut himself off from everyone around him. Her younger sister Amanda, who was Eric’s best friend, said he’d ignored every attempt she made to contact him. “I suppose we can’t really blame him, after all he just lost his sister in some freak accident.”

With Melissa still holding his hand, Kyle started walking towards the tree Eric was leaning against. Once he got close enough, he said, “Hey man, how are you doing?”

The look on Eric’s face as he looked at Kyle was fraught with emotion. There was a moment of silence before Eric finally said, “I just buried my sister, Kyle; how do you think I’m doing?”

“You know, I’ve never understood why people ask that question in cases like this.” Leaning against the tree, Kyle said, “I know you’re hurting right now; but we’re all here for you.”

“Liz told me the same thing at the church.” Sighing, Eric continued, “You guys were Olivia’s friends; why would you be so concerned about her little brother?”

Melissa and Kyle exchanged looks with each other; with Melissa turning her attention back to Eric. “You’re our best friend’s brother, Eric; of course we care about you.”

******************************


While Olivia’s friends were mourning her loss on Earth; an untold distance away two alien figures were entering a small room. The shorter of the two, a female, looked at the other and said, “Have you been able to find out any more about our patient, Healer D’Pkeni?”

“No Mercy D’Sora; the High Council won’t tell us more than they already have.” Walking over to a console, Healer D’Pkeni said,
“All we know is that she’s from Earth and approximately 17 years old.”

Mercy D’Sora looked through the window at their patient; lying in bed with tubes hooked up to her. She didn't know much about humanity; but from what little she did knew about them, Mercy D’Sora suspected that the patient would have been considered attractive on Earth. Turning back to Healer D’Pkeni, she said, “Humanity only achieved rudimentary spaceflight 60 years ago; how could they have advanced this far in such a short amount of time?”

Heading towards a nearby door, Healer D’Pkeni said, “According to what I’ve been told, she arrived from one of our abandoned bases.”

“What’s the council going to do now?” Following Healer D’Pkeni through the door, Mercy D’Sora said, “Could this mean they’re ready for us to contact them?”

Stopping next to the bed, Healer D’Pkeni said, “I’m afraid that decision is above our pay grade.” Reaching to pull the covers off, he said, “Right now our duty is to ensure her body doesn’t reject her replacement arm.”

Looking over the Healer’s shoulder, Mercy D’Sora saw the new arm they’d spent the last three days growing. It was nothing like the girl’s original arm; however, instead it was identical in appearance to those belonging to Mercy D’Sora and Healer D’Pkeni – a dark blue color with four fingers instead of five.
111.title: The Funeral

1111.content:
Olivia had experienced fleeting moments on consciousness over the last few days; but the seriousness of her injuries prevented her from completely remembering what happened. She had images of strange looking people standing around her, talking in an unfamiliar language.

As she started to regain consciousness once again, she could hear what sounded like beeping coming from somewhere nearby. Slowly opening her eyes, she looked around and found herself in an unfamiliar room – unlike anything she’d ever seen before in her life. The room looked like something out of those campy 80s sci-fi movies Eric was always making her watch with him – smooth, shiny surfaces everywhere. Where am I?

There didn’t seem to be anyone around that she could see; she tried to call out but quickly discovered that her voice was gone. How long was I out? Reaching to pull off the covers, Olivia sat up in the bed. Spotting a nearby doorway, Olivia hopped off the bed; stumbling briefly as her legs felt like Jell-O. Slowly making her way to the doorway, she peeked inside and found herself inside what could have only been a bathroom.

Walking up to the sink, Olivia looked at herself in the mirror; the first thought on her mind being that her hair looked like crap. Reaching up to quickly run a hand through her hair, Olivia froze when she saw her arm in the mirror. Gasping in shock, she looked down and saw that her entire arm, going just past her shoulder, was a dark shade of blue. What surprised her even more was the fact that there were only 4 fingers on her hand.

Her voice returning at that moment, Olivia screamed as she stared at the alien appendage. There must’ve been someone nearby when she started screaming, because Olivia could hear footsteps just outside the door. Thinking everything was going to be alright, she opened the door and came face to face with a blue-skinned alien.

The last thing Olivia saw before fainting was the alien stepping towards her.
1111.title: Olivia Wakes Up

11111.content:
Waking up once again, Olivia found herself lying in bed, “Mom, I just had the strangest dream; there were these aliens, and my right arm was really messed up.” Sitting up in bed, Olivia pulled her arms out from under the sheets only to find her right arm was just as blue and four-fingered as before, “Oh crap, that wasn’t a dream.”

A nearby door opened before Olivia had a chance to fully everything; she watched as the two aliens from earlier entered the room. Getting a good look at them, she noticed they looked pretty similar except for the fact that the female’s head was oddly shaped. Looking at a device in his hands, the male said, “How are you feeling, Terran woman?”

Dozens of questions flooded Olivia’s mind; chief among them being how these aliens spoke perfect English. “That’s kind of hard to say,” looking around, she said, “Perhaps you can tell me where I am, and what the hell’s wrong with my arm?”

“You’re on our home world, Maltor Prime.” Moving closer, the female with the odd-shaped head said, “You were sent here through one of abandoned bases; one of many that we’ve used over the centuries to observe your species. Due to years of disuse the equipment fell into disrepair, which resulted in a malfunction that caused the loss of your arm."

While the female checked something on a nearby display, the male said, “As for your arm; well we grew one identical to ours to replace the one you lost.” With a smile, he said, “I must say, I think we did a good job; give it a few days and it’ll be as if you’d been born with it.”

“I guess so; I just would’ve preferred one that had five fingers and, you know, wasn’t blue.” Looking at them, Olivia said, “But I
suppose I shouldn’t be picky; after all, you saved my life. So, who do I have to thank?"

Placing a hand on his chest, the male said, “My name is Healer D’Pkeni; my assistant is Mercy D’Sora.”

While Oliva had been speaking with Healer D’Pkeni, Mercy D’Sora had been looking at Olivia’s vitals. Suddenly something peculiar caught her attention. Moving towards Olivia, she lowered her gown, “Healer, you should take a look at this.”

Olivia and Healer D’Pkeni looked down to see what had caught Mercy D’Sora’s attention, “What the hell?”

Before she’d fainted, only Olivia’s arm had been blue; now the blue coloration was threatening to take over her right breast. Scanning Olivia was a small device, D’Pkeni said, “It appears the Maltorian DNA in your arm is slowly overriding your human DNA.” Concerned, he said, “If this continues, you may well find yourself becoming a Maltorian."

“Please tell me you can stop it.” Worried, Olivia said, “I’m grateful to be alive; but I’m not exactly interested in becoming one of you.”

“Nothing like this has happened before, but I’ll see what I can do.”
11111.title: Bringing Olivia Up to Speed

111111.content:
Healer D’Pkeni took several blood samples to run tests on before he left the room. Olivia had been hoping for some company, so she was discouraged to see D’Sora leaving. Seeing the look on Olivia’s face, she said, “I’ll be back shortly; I have to finish some rounds before my shift ends.”

Once she was alone in the room, Olivia took the opportunity to process her current situation. Waking up on an alien world should’ve had her freaking out, but she was surprisingly calm. It didn’t take much for her to surmise that she’d been injected with something to keep her calm.

***************************


There was no way for Olivia to know how much time had gone by; she was practicing picking things up with her new arm when D’Sora returned with a tray. Seeing the pile on the floor, D’Sora figured out what Olivia had been doing, “Don’t worry, you’ll get the hang of it eventually.”

“Thanks, I guess.” With a weak smile, Olivia said, “What’s on the tray?”

“I thought you might be hungry, so I brought you some food.” As she placed the tray on a nearby table, D’Sora said, “I realize it’s not what you’re used to eating, but it’s quite good.”

Olivia didn’t have much of an appetite at that moment, so she said, “I’ll save that for later.”

Pulling a chair up to the bed, D’Sora said, “I imagine you must have a lot of questions.”

That was an understatement to say the least, Olivia’s mind was filled with questions that she wanted to ask. But she didn’t want to overwhelm D’Sora, so she decided to only pick a few of them. “Would it be a stretch for me to assume Mercy isn’t your first name?”

D’Sora chuckled, “No, that’s my job title; I’m what you would think of as a nurse.” Pausing, she said, “My first name is Maiya, what’s yours?”

Reaching out with her new arm, Olivia said, “It’s nice to meet you, Maiya; my name’s Olivia.”

So began a back and forth between the two as the two of them each asked questions about their respective cultures. Olivia learned that Maltorians had a planetary government, with each of the 10 nations represented on a ruling council; that Maltorian women received the same rights as men. Olivia had to pause when she heard that, saying, “Wow; women on Earth are still struggling to be treated equally to men. My mom makes less than her male coworker for working the same job; one, I might add, that she’s had longer.”

“Our society was like that for a time; but we moved past that about 100 years ago.” With a smile, Maiya explained, “In Maltorian society, everyone is treated the same regardless of their background or religion.”

“Are there different religions here?”

“Sort of; they all worship the goddess Chrestus, but each religion takes a different approach to her teachings.”

The conversation continued after that, with Olivia asking how the Maltorians discovered Earth. Maiya went quiet for a moment before she said, “We’ve been watching your species for close to 5000 years; but I’m afraid the means of discovery has been lost to time.” Looking at Olivia, Maiya said, “Every Maltorian child has been taught about your world, but there’s still much I didn’t know. I thank you for filling in the gaps.”

Olivia had been staring at Maiya’s head off and on during their conversation; becoming fixated on its odd shape. “If you don’t mind my asking, Maiya; why is your head shaped differently than D’Pkeni’s?”

“The shape of my head is a result of sexual maturity; once a female Maltorian reaches puberty, she undergoes changes much like your species would.”

Olivia surreptitiously brought a hand up to her head, saying, “What are the chances that my head will change shape?”

“It wouldn’t be appropriate for me to speculate, I’m not a Healer.” Sighing, Maiya said, “If I had to venture a guess, I’d say you might experience some changes.”

Suddenly a bird landed outside the window; Olivia looked at it and saw its feathers were colors that she’d never seen before. But the biggest difference she saw was that it had two sets of wings. Turning her attention back to Maiya, Olivia said, “Am I able to go outside?”

“Sure, I don’t see why not.” Getting up, Maiya said, “I’ll be right back with a hover-chair.”
111111.title: Olivia Makes A Friend

1111111.content:
After getting Olivia situated in the hover-chair, Maiya pushed her through the building on their way towards the exit. On the way Olivia noticed people staring at her and murmuring; it wasn’t a stretch for her to assume they’d never seen a human before. Leaning towards Olivia as they entered an elevator, Maiya said, “I hope you’re not the shy type, Olivia; because word of your arrival has spread across the planet.”

As the elevator started its journey downward, Olivia said, “What does your religion say about people from another planet?” glancing up at Maiya, she said, “I’m not going to be in danger, right?”

“You have nothing to worry about.” Smiling, Maiya said, “Chrestus teaches us to protect and cherish all forms of life; even a species as primitive as yours.”

For a moment Olivia wanted to lash out at Maiya’s remark; until realizing that she was right, “I suppose, compared to your species, Humans are pretty primitive.” Sitting back as the elevator door opened, Olivia continued, “I’m sure we’ll reach this level someday, if we don’t kill each other first.”

Pushing Olivia down another hall, Maiya said, “If it’s any consolation, your species has progressed at a much faster rate than we expected over the last 100 years.” Smiling, she said, “It took our species 200 years to go from primitive flight to spending people into space; whereas your species landed someone on your moon only 66 years later after your first flight.”

As they went outside, Olivia said, “So what you’re saying is that Humanity is an enigma?”

Moving down a ramp, Maiya said, “Pretty much.”

Olivia took in her surroundings as Maiya guided her towards a small pond nearby. The scenery was so familiar that Olivia would’ve easily thought it was Earth, had it not been for the aliens. As they approached the pond, Olivia could see more birds flying around as well as what appeared to be fish in the water.

She even took the opportunity to look at the nearby Maltorians, both young and old. She smiled to herself when she saw a man sitting under a tree with a pregnant woman. Turning her attention back to Maiya, she said, “I’m curious, Maiya; how many different intelligent species are out there?”

“In this sector of space? Only three; Maltorians, Humanity and a species called the Creel.” Smiling as she parked the hover-chair and moved to sit next to Olivia, Maiya said, “I think you’d like them; they’re similar to the mermaids of Earth mythology.”

That idea interested Olivia, who hoped she’d get to see them some day. As the two of them sat by the pond for a little while, Olivia looked around and saw the other Maltorians nearby. Turning her attention to Maiya, she said, “We spent all this time talking about your culture; but I don’t know anything about you.”

“I’m afraid my life’s not all that interesting, Olivia.” Sitting on the ground next to the hover-chair, Maiya said, “My parents were killed during a robbery 8 years ago; leaving me to raise my little sister by myself.”

Olivia frowned when she heard that; saddened to hear what Maiya had experienced, while also feeling disappointed that such things would still happen in an advanced society such as this. “I’m sorry, I-I didn’t know.”

“There’s no need to apologize, you were a child living on another planet.” Wiping her face, Maiya said, “Unfortunately that wasn’t the end of my tragic life; I lost my fiancé two years ago in a shuttle accident.”

After that, to liven the mood, Maiya asked Olivia about her life; which she was more than happy to discuss. Looking at Maiya, as she started to feel homesick, Olivia said, “Be honest; what are the chances that I’ll ever see my family again?”

Maiya was about to answer, when she was suddenly interrupted by someone yelling out, “Maiya!”

Maiya and Olivia turned to see a Maltorian girl, around Olivia’s age, running up to them. Olivia watched as they greeted each other, interlocking the fingers of one hand while touching foreheads. “Hi D’ana, what brings you here?”

“I had some free time so...”

D’ana stopped midsentence when she spotted Olivia sitting next to Maiya; the look on her face was one of shock. Feeling uneasy, Olivia said, “Hi.”
1111111.title: Going Outside

11111111.content:
Olivia was thrown off by what was going on as D’ana knelt in front of her. Her voice almost reverent, D’ana said, “Wow, an actual human; I thought it’d be years before I got to meet one.”

Looking at D’ana, suddenly not a fan of all the attention she was getting, Olivia said, “I hope I’m worth it.”

The expression of Olivia’s face was enough for D’ana to realize she might be overdoing it. “I’m sorry; I can get a little excited at times.” Getting back to her feet, D’ana explained, “I’m in my first year of what you’d consider college; it’s my dream to visit Earth and observe your species, maybe even interact with them.”

“Well you better enjoy me while you can.” Lifting her new arm, Olivia said, “I had my arm replaced; and not I’m slowly turning to a Maltorian.”

“I’m truly sorry to hear that; but I’m sure everything will work out for you.” Trying to sound sincere, D’ana said, “After all, Chrestus kept you alive for a week; she must have something planned...”

Maiya’s face dropped when she heard that, “Oh no.” turning to Olivia, she said, “Olivia, stay calm!”

“You want to me to stay calm? I’ve been missing for a week, my family probably thinks I’m dead!” looking at Maiya, struggling to remain calm, Olivia said, “You have to send me home; so fire up that transporter!”

With an authoritative tone that D’ana had never heard before, Maiya said, “Under no circumstances will I allow that; last time you lost an arm, who knows what you might lose if you went through again.”

Her legs a little wobbly, Olivia managed to get to her feet, “Then I’ll find another way; because I’m not staying here without my parents knowing I’m still alive."
11111111.title: Olivia Gets Shocking News

111111111.content:
Healer D’Pkeni had just finished with another patient, and was on his way to mid-day meal, when he was notified of a setback in Olivia’s case. Running through the building, he arrived outside Olivia’s room to find Maiya and D’ana standing outside. As he got closer, he could hear Olivia yelling from inside the room.

After exchanging a greeting with his daughter, D’Pkeni turned his attention to Maiya and said, “Tell me what happened, Mercy.”

D’ana stepped forward just as Maiya was about to speak, “It’s my fault, father; I was on my way to visit you for mid-day meal when I met Olivia and Maiya outside.” Lowering her head in shame, D’ana continued, “I introduced myself to Olivia; and in the process of doing so, revealed that she’d been here for a week.”

For a moment D’Pkeni considered admonishing his daughter, until he realized the situation was just as much his fault as hers. “With everything going on, I suppose I should’ve made more of an effort to tell Olivia everything.” Sighing, D’Pkeni said, “I’ll go see if I can’t calm her down.”

With Maiya and D’ana watching from outside the room, D’Pkeni entered to find Olivia glaring at him. It seemed that teenagers were the same regardless of the species, because Olivia had the same look on her face that his children would give him when they were upset. Before he’d even had a chance to close the door, Olivia said, “You should’ve told me how long I’ve been here.”

“I know; and I’m sorry I didn’t.” sitting next to Olivia, D’Pkeni said, “I can’t promise anything; but I’ll try to get permission to, at the very least, let you send message to Earth.”

“I doubt it would do any good; they probably already think I’m dead if all they found was my arm.” Sighing, Olivia said, “You guys have spaceships, right? Wouldn’t it make more sense to take me back to Earth?”

“I suppose so; but such a journey would still take several months.” Getting to his feet, D’Pkeni said, “I’ll arrange a meeting with the Council to discuss our options.”

Olivia’s eyes gravitated towards her arm; after looking at it for a moment, she turned to D’Pkeni and said, “Let’s say they do agree to let me go back to Earth; what’s the likelihood that I’ll even be human once we get there?”

“I don’t like to speculate; but I’m working on something that can slow the changes.” Turning back to Olivia, D’Pkeni said, “I suspect you’ll likely be a hybrid of our two species by that point.”

“Oh joy; I return home to my folks but I’ll be half-alien.”
111111111.title: D'Pkeni Speaks with Olivia

1111111111.content:
Before he went off to speak with the Council, D’Pkeni gave Olivia a container with all her personal items inside it. Placing it on the bed in front of her, D’Pkeni said, “I thought you might want to have these back; I took the liberty of charging your cell phone for you.”

Olivia briefly considered asking D’Pkeni how he knew what a cell phone was, until she remembered that Maltorians had been watching humans for years. “Thanks,” digging her phone out of the container, Olivia said, “Good luck with the Council.”

D’Pkeni started walking towards the door, only to stop and look at Olivia, “I know you’re hoping for the best; but you should also prepare for the worst.” Stepping back towards Olivia, D’Pkeni said, “If the Council were to rule against your request, I’ll make sure that you end up with a loving family here on Maltor Prime.”

As she turned her phone on, Olivia said, “I appreciate the concern; but I have faith that it will go in my favor.”

With a smile, D'Pkeni said, "I'll let you know what the Council decides."
1111111111.title: Having a Moment with D'Pkeni

11111111111.content:
Barely 30 minutes had passed since D’Pkeni left to speak with the Council; the decreasing light outside told Olivia that nighttime was coming. She was busy scrolling through some of her photos from the hike when there was a knock on the door. Without looking up from her phone, Olivia said, “Come in.”

The door opened and Olivia could hear footsteps entering the room; she finally looked up long enough to see D’ana standing just inside the doorway. The expression on her face told Olivia that D’ana was worried about something, “I thought you might want some company; but I’ll understand if you don’t want me to be here.”

“No, you can stay.” Putting her phone down, Olivia said, “If you’re wondering if I’m upset with you about earlier, you’ve got nothing to worry about.”

“Oh good, because I actually was worried about that.” With a chuckle, D’ana walked over and took a seat next to the bed, “You’re the first human I’ve ever met in person; I was worried that I’d upset you.”

“Again, you’re fine; I was probably more upset with your dad anyway.”

“I overheard him talking with D’Sora about going before the Council; something about seeking to let you return to Earth?”

“Yeah,” leaning back in bed, Olivia said, “Don’t get me wrong; from what I’ve seen your world is amazing, but I’d much rather be back on my world.”

“So, I guess I should take advantage of having you around.” Leaning forward on the bed, D’ana said, “I’d love to pick your brain.”

“I can do you one better.” Holding up her phone, Olivia said, “I’ve got literally 1000s of photos of life on Earth; I’d be more than willing to show them to you.”

“You bet!”

After getting over her initial excitement, D’ana carefully climbed into bed next to Olivia as the latter started scrolling through the photos. She focused mostly on photos of her and her friends, interspersed with photos from the hiking trip. It wasn’t until she got to photos of her family that Olivia noticed a change in D’ana’s demeanor.

“Hey, are you okay?”

D’ana was silent for a moment as her face was glued to the screen; showing a photo of Olivia with her parents and Eric at a wedding earlier in the year. Pulling herself away, D’ana said, “Yeah, I’m fine; it’s just those people look familiar.”

“Those are my parents,” Chuckling, Olivia said, “I don’t see how you’d find them familiar.”

D’ana was silent for a few moments until she said, “You’re probably right.”

****************


Meanwhile, some distance away, D’Pkeni was walking into the Council Chamber…
11111111111.title: Olivia Gets a Visitor

111111111111.content:
The Council chamber was 20 letra from the Medical Center, D’Pkeni had to use the transportation system to reach it. As he waited outside the Hall, he went through everything he was going to say; knowing full well that Oliva’s future depended on him.

It wasn’t long before the door opened and a Maltorian woman stepped out, “Healer D’Pkeni, the Council will see you now.”

Getting to his feet, D’Pkeni followed the woman into the council chamber, seeing the 10 representatives sitting in a half-circle around the High Minister. In contrast to the outfits worn by D’Pkeni and the woman, which were similar in appearance to Terran jogging suits, the members of the Council were all wearing robes.

The woman led D’Pkeni up to a podium; helping to get him situated before leaving. Once she was out of the room, the High Minister stood, “Healer Qu’ris D’Pkeni, for what reason are you requesting an audience with us?”

“High Minster, esteemed Council members, I come before you with a request.” Closing his eyes for a moment, D’Pkeni said, “As you know, I’ve been in charge of treatment for the Terran female who arrived Earth.”

Looking at something D’Pkeni couldn’t see, the High Minister said, “I understand that this girl, Olivia, is experiencing an unforeseen side effect in her treatment?”

“That’s right, High Minister,” pausing to catch his breath, D’Pkeni said, “I’m still endeavoring to find out exactly why this is happening; but it appears that Olivia’s original DNA is being overwritten by our own.”

D’Pkeni knew some of the Council members had science backgrounds, but the High Minister wasn’t one of them. While several members spoke amongst themselves, the High Minster said, “What does that mean, exactly?”

“If I can’t find a way to reverse the effects; within a matter of weeks, Olivia Sheppard will cease to be Human.”

The murmuring increased for a moment, until one of the Council members said, “Healer D’Pkeni, you’ve spent some time on Earth; haven’t you?”

“Yes Councilor, my wife Ma’gi and I spent almost a year on Earth until circumstances forced us to leave.” Taken back by the unexpected question. D’Pkeni said, “I fail to see how that has any bearing on my prescence here.”

Exchanging a look with the High Minister, the Council member said, “That's what I'm hoping to find out; if your past experiences on Earth are what drove you to come before us.”

The question gave D’Pkeni pause, as it pertained to something only a select few on the planet knew about, “Those circumstances have nothing do with why I'm here, Councilor,” sighing, D’Pkeni said, “I’m just doing everything I can to help a young girl; one who didn’t ask for any of this.”

Facing D’Pkeni, the High Minister said, “What exactly is your request, Healer D’Pkeni?”

Taking a deep breath, D’Pkeni said, “The young girl in my care, Olivia, has requested she be allowed to return to Earth in order to inform her loved ones that she’s still alive.”

The High Minister did his best to silence his fellow Council members as they started to speak loudly amongst themselves. Once he managed to succeed in doing that, he turned to D’Pkeni and said, “We’ll discuss your request, Healer; please wait outside until we’ve made our decision.”

After politely excusing himself, D’Pkeni made his way to the door, saying to himself, “It’s in Chrestus’ hands now, Olivia.”

*****************************


The Council took the better part of an hour to deliberate amongst themselves; D’Pkeni passed the time by reviewing some of his other patients. He’d just sent a message to Maiya about Olivia’s condition when the woman from earlier returned and led him back into the Council chamber. Once she left, the High Minister said, “Your request caused much debate, Healer; but I believe we’ve come to the right decision.”

Holding his breath in anticipation, D’Pkeni said, “What decision would that be, High Minister?”

Looking at his fellow Council members, the High Minister said, “We’ve decided that _______.”

Note – 1 letra = 2.5 miles
111111111111.title: D'Pkeni Goes Before the Council

1111111111111.content:
D’Pkeni could barely hold his joy as he heard the High Minister say, “Olivia Sheppard is free to return to Earth.”

Struggling to control his emotions inside the hallowed Council chamber, D’Pkeni said, “Thank you, Minister; this will mean so much to her.”

“I’m afraid there are some stipulations that go along with our decision, Healer.” Pausing, to take a breath, the High Minister said, “While returning Olivia to Earth will be the primary objective; we’ll be sending an observation team along as well, in order to determine if Humanity is ready to make contact."

“Minister, I would like to be part of that observation team.” Looking at the High Minister, D’Pkeni said, “As you know; I left Earth because of unexpected circumstances. I believe this current situation will allow me to rectify those circumstances.”

The High Minister conversed with his fellow Council members for a moment. Turning back to D’Pkeni, he said, “You have our blessing, Healer.”

With that, the High Minister and the Council members rose as one and left the chamber; signifying that both the discussion, and the audience, had ended. Healer D'Pkeni remained behind until after they left. He called his wife, Ma’gi, as he walked down the steps of the Council Building. After updating her on everything that’s happened, she said, “You do realize what this means, Q’uris.”

“Yes, my wife; we’ll have to tell D’ana the truth about her origins.” Covering his mouth briefly, D’Pkeni said, “I’ll speak to her once we return home; but first I need to tell Olivia the good news.”

“We never should have waited this long to come clean, Q’uris,” With a sigh, Ma’gi said, “We’re about to shatter everything these girls think they know about their lives.”

“I know that, Ma’gi; which is why it has to be handled delicately.”

Ma’gi looked at something off screen before returning her attention to D’Pkeni, “Do you think they’ll be able to handle what’s to come?”

“They’re both strong, Ma’gi; I suspect, given time, that it will as be as if they’d grown up together.”

******************************


D’Pkeni returned to Olivia’s room; walking inside to find D’ana sitting in bed with Olivia as the two looked at Olivia’s cell phone. After making his presence known, the two of them shared the same expression on their faces, They look so much alike, he thought, But then, that’s hardly surprising.

As Olivia put her phone down. D’ana said, “How did it go with the Council, Father?”

“The Council has agreed to return Olivia to Earth.” D’Pkeni paused to let the girls squeal with joy, “It’s their opinion that Olivia’s arrival here could signify that Humanity is ready; so they’re also sending an observation team along.”

With tears of joy, Olivia jumped out of bed and ran to hug D’Pkeni, “Thank you.”

Embracing Olivia as he would D’ana, D’Pkeni said, “You’re welcome, Olivia.”

Walking up behind Olivia, D’ana said, “When does the mission depart, Father?”

“Things like this take time, D’ana; surely you remember how much planning went into your Aunt’s mission to Creel,” With a sigh,
D’Pkeni said, “However, while we wait, I’ll see what I can do about slowing down Olivia’s transformation.”

“I’d appreciate that, D’Pkeni; it’s bad enough I’ll have to explain what happened to my arm and why I’m turning blue.” Gesturing to D’ana’s skull as an example, Olivia chuckled and said, “I’d prefer it if my skull was as close to its original shape as possible.”

D’Pkeni and D’ana stayed for a little while longer, until deciding it was time to leave. D’Pkeni watched from the door as D’ana hugged Olivia and said, “I’ll come by tomorrow; perhaps even introduce you to some of my friends.”

Still hugging D’ana, Olivia said, “I’d like that.”
1111111111111.title: Olivia Can Return to Earth

11111111111112.content:
The silence during the journey home from the Medical Center was unsettling; Q’uris hadn’t seen D’ana this quiet in a long time. Putting his runabout on autopilot, he turned to his daughter and said, “What is on your mind, daughter?”

D’ana turned away from the window as she looked at her father, Is Olivia my sister? Taking a deep breath, D’ana said,
“There’s nothing on my mind, Father; I was just thinking about some of images Olivia showed me from Earth.” Looking straight ahead, she said, “Some of the images reminded me of ones from when Mother and you were on Earth.”

Q’uris wasn’t buying that answer whatsoever, “I know when something is on your mind, D’ana; why have you suddenly gone silent?”

Why did you never tell me the truth? With a look on her face unlike anything Q’uris had ever seen before, D’ana said, “If you must know, Father; Olivia being here has made me think about something I haven’t thought of in many years.”

Q’uris grew worried as he looked at D’ana, seeing the pained look on her face – does she know the truth? Reaching out to take his daughter’s hand, Q’uris said, “It’s not like you to be so silent, D’ana; especially since your Mother and I have never kept anything from you.”

That was all it took for D’ana to lash out in anger; pulling her hand away as she became angrier then Q’uris had ever seen before. “Are you sure about that, Father? Are you sure there’s nothing you’ve kept from me?”

Oh Chrestus, she knows. As the car turned off the speed route, Q’uris said, “D’ana, honey, I’m sorry we never told you; but we feared you’d react like this.”

“I’m sorry; but how is someone supposed to react after learning their entire life has been a lie!” D’ana stared at her father, a look of utter betrayal in her eyes, “Why did you and Mother never tell me that I was born on Earth?”

Had Q’uris been driving when D’ana said that, they both likely would’ve been gravely injured. Trying his best to remain composed, Q’uris turned to D’ana and said, “How long have you known?”

“I found out a few years ago; after we moved into the bigger house,” D’ana looked at her father, calming down ever so slightly. “I was unpacking some containers in my room when I came across a Terran DVD. It took some effort, but I managed to play it; I saw the message my human parents left for me.”

Q’uris thought back to that fateful evening 18 years earlier when his life had been changed forever. “You were dying of cancer, D’ana; your birth parents...they were desperate to find a way to cure your condition,” taking a breath, Q’uris continued, “Brian and Gloria, they were kind to your mother and me. We offered to help cure you, but there was an unexpected complication...”

Looking away from Q’uris, D’ana said, “I was turned into a Maltorian.”

“Yes.” with a curt nod, Q’uris said, “The four of us knew you’d never be safe on Earth; so your Mother and I offered to bring you with us, to raise you as our child.”

Tears running down her face, D’ana said, “The message I found; you were going to give it to me when I was older?”

“Yes, we were.”

There were a few minutes of silence as the runabout continued its journey; eventually D’ana looked at Q’uris, “Olivia’s my sister, isn’t she?”

“Yes, Olivia is your sister.” With a sigh, Q’uris said, “Based on her age, I suspect your mother was very early in her pregnancy when you left.”

“I kind of suspected after seeing my birth parents in her photos.” Looking forward, out the window, D’ana said, “Does she know?”

“No, she doesn’t.” taking his daughter’s hand, Q’uris said, “Now that you know the truth, I think it’s only fair for you to tell her.”
11111111111112.title: The Truth Comes Out

111111111111121.content:
D’ana woke up the next morning, her mind still reeling from the night before. After returning home with her father, she got into a lengthy discussion with her parents about what they’d kept from her all these years. That inevitably led to her younger brother, Narek, finding out the truth as well; causing him to second guess everything he thought he’d known.

After stepping out of the pulse cleaner, D’ana got dressed and went downstairs for breakfast. Upon entering the kitchen, she saw that everyone else was already awake. Ma’gi placed a bowl of pavlova and a glass of neshta juice on the table as D’ana sat down. Looking away from her food, to no one in particular, D’ana said, “I’m sorry about everything I said last night; I-I was just angry.”

“You have nothing to be sorry for, D’ana.” Taking a seat next to her daughter, Ma’gi said, “You were right; your father and I should’ve told you the truth years ago.”

Taking a sip of her juice, D’ana said, “I suppose I can’t be too mad at you guys; after all, I’d probably would’ve died had you not done anything.”

Looking up from his food, Narek said, “So does Olivia know the truth yet?”

“No Narek, she doesn’t know yet.” Staring at his son from across the table, Q’uris said, “Your mother and I agreed that D’ana should be the one who tells her.”

“So there’s no pressure then; Olivia’s still reeling from the last major disruption to her life.” Sighing, D’ana continued, “Why not add to that by telling her that I’m the older sister everyone thought went missing 16 years ago.”

Getting up to put his dishes away, Q’uris said, “If you don’t want to tell her, I’ll be more than willing to do it.”

“No, it should come from me; I’ll just have to figure out how to break it to her gently.”

****************************


D’ana was on the steps of the Medical Center, having been sitting there for the last 15 minutes trying to get the courage to see Olivia. She’d already decided on what she was going to say, even going so far as to bring the recorded message as proof.
Looking at the time on a nearby clock, D’ana realized she only 20 minutes before Narek and her friends arrived. Getting to her feet, D’ana said to herself, “Might as well get this done before they get here.”

Exiting the lift onto the Center’s Intensive Care Ward, D’ana showed her ID to the Guard stationed outside the closed unit.
Normally there wouldn’t be a guard at the door, but the hospital took added security measures once Olivia had arrived. Arriving outside Olivia’s door, D’ana took a deep breath before knocking, “Olivia, it’s D’ana; can I come in?”

A few seconds passed before D’ana heard Olivia say, “Sure, come on in.”

D’ana opened the door and stepped inside; only to stop when she saw Olivia standing inside the bathroom door. It seemed the changes had continued over night; with the blue coloration now reaching the bottom of Olivia’s neck. Closing the door behind her, D’ana said, “I guess the treatments aren’t really helping?”

“No, but your dad said that was a possibility.” Getting into bed, Olivia said, “He was here earlier getting samples to make a more effective treatment. Also said you had something you needed to tell me?”

Pulling a chair up to Olivia’s bedside, D’ana said, “Yeah I do; and it’s pretty big.”

Staring at D’ana, an eyebrow raised, Olivia said, “You mean bigger than slowly turning into an alien?”

“Yeah, much bigger than that.” Taking several deep breaths, D’ana said, “I’m your older sister.”
111111111111121.title: The Next Day

1111111111111211.content:
Given the circumstances, D’ana thought Olivia was taking things remarkably well under the circumstances; despite not saying anything for almost 10 minutes. Olivia’s gaze shift from the tablet, which had a picture of her parents frozen on the screen, to D’ana. Eventually, however, D’ana started to become uneasy and shifted herself around in the chair. That was when Olivia spoke, “This can’t be possible.”

“This from the girl who’s slowly changing species?” getting up from her chair, D’ana walked over and took the tablet, “If I wasn’t your sister, then how could I have gotten this?”

“How should I know; you could’ve created this from my memories or something.”

Shaking her head in dismay, D’ana said, “We don’t have that kind of technology; and even if we did, we wouldn’t use it on something as trivial as this.”

“Look D’ana, I haven’t the faintest idea where that video came from; but I know you’re not my sister.” Hopping out of bed, Olivia said, “My sister was kidnapped 17 years ago, the police looked everywhere but didn’t find anything. Considering her cancer diagnosis, everyone just assumed she was dead.”

D’ana paced round in a circle for a moment, “Saying I was kidnapped was the best way to hide what really happened; even if it was a bit much.”

Sitting on the edge of the bed, Olivia said, “Okay D’ana, then tell me what really happened.”

D’ana cautiously approached Olivia and sat next to her, “Like you said, I was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer; my...our parents were desperate to find a cure.” Taking a breath as she gazed up at the ceiling, D’ana continued, “My adopted parents were on Earth observing your species; the four of them became friends. One day they approached our parents with an offer to help; only no one could predict there’d be an unforeseen side effect.”

D’ana watched as Olivia’s expression slowly changed from disbelief to acceptance, “Whatever they gave you, it turned you into a Maltorian.”

With a nod, D’ana said, “The four of them realized I wouldn’t be safe on Earth, so I was brought here and raised as a Maltorian.” Taking a deep breath, D’ana said, “If it makes you feel any better, I was pretty upset when I found out the truth; it’s not easy finding out your entire life was a lie.”

“I can’t really blame you for that, I’m sure I’d react the same way if it happened to me.”

D’ana sensed Olivia’s tone was changing, “Does that mean you believe me?”

Olivia turned towards D’ana with a sympathetic look, “There’s still a lot I don’t fully understand; but yeah, I believe you.” Grasping D’ana’s hand in hers, Olivia said, “So what happens now?”

Ignoring for the moment a beeping noise coming from her tablet, D’ana said, “I’ll have to discuss it with my folks; but I’d really like a chance to meet my birth parents.”

Looking at D’ana with a smile, Olivia said, “I can already see how that will go; they’ll both be shocked to see you and to learn that what’s happening to me.”

Having gotten up to retrieve her tablet, D’ana saw a message from Narek – We’re out in the courtyard. “Relax, I’m sure you’ll still look like them when we get to Earth.” Looking at Olivia, she said, “You feel like meeting some friends of mine? They’re outside with my brother.”

Chuckling as she hopped off the bed, Olivia said, “Sure, why not.”

As she led Olivia out of the room, D'ana said, "What do you think your loved ones are doing right now?
1111111111111211.title: Coming Clean to Olivia

11111111111112111.content:
It was a cold and rainy evening on Earth, perfect weather for a family still in mourning. Barely a day had passed since Olivia’s funeral and hardly a word had been spoken by anyone. Gloria Sheppard turned to baking to occupy her time, her husband Brian was focusing on a major upcoming project at work, while her son Eric was spending the evening at a friend’s house.

Having just put her 4th pie in the oven, Gloria found herself standing outside the door to Olivia’s bedroom; a place no one had entered since the accident. For a fleeting moment she considered reaching out and opening the door; only to be interrupted by a noise coming from outside.

Going down the stairs, she noticed a large envelope had been dropped through the mail slot; a quick look out the window showed that no one was nearby. Picking up the envelope, she opened it and saw a series of photos. It took her a moment to realize they were from the scene of Olivia’s death. Why would someone give these to us?

As she looked through the photos, she realized some of the markings on the debris looked familiar. The more she looked at them, the more familiar they became, “Oh my God!” running down the hall, Gloria said, “Brian!”

Poking his head out of his office, Brian said, “What?”

Shoving the photos into his hands, Gloria said, “Someone just dropped these through the mail slot; tell me those markings look familiar to you.”

Brian looked at the photos for a moment; until all color drained from his face, “Those are Maltorian markings.”

Tearing up, Gloria said, “I don’t want to jump the gun here, but...”

Brian’s face hardened, “Let’s not jump to any conclusion just yet.” Taking the rest of the photos from Gloria, Brian walked back into his office and retrieved his cell phone.

“Who are you calling?”

Looking up from the phone, Brian said, “The only other person on Earth who knows about the Maltorians.”
11111111111112111.title: The Mystery Deepens

111111111111121111.content:
Narek sat on a bench with a view the Center’s main entrance; patiently waiting for D’ana to come out with Olivia. The sound of laughter nearby caught his attention as he turned to see his friends Sorain and Asura talking about something nearby. Sorain was Maiya’s younger sister and an old friend of D’ana’s while Asura was a friend of Narek’s.

Laughing to themselves as they came to join Narek, Sorain said, “So what can you tell us about Olivia?”

“Not much I’m afraid; my dad’s keeping things close to the vest on this one.” Pausing, Narek said, “All I know for sure is that she’s
around our age and arrived through an abandoned transporter from Earth.”

“D’ana said something about her slowly turning into one of us.” looking at her friend, Asura said, “Is that true?”

“Yeah; apparently her human DNA is slowly being overwritten by ours.” Pausing to catch his breath, Narek said, “My dad said he’d try and slow it down; but I imagine she’ll be more Maltorian then human by the time she gets to Earth.”

“I still don’t understand why the Council approved your dad’s request; I didn’t think we’d make contact with them for another 50 years or so.”

Looking at Asura, Narek said, “I guess they figured there were extenuating circumstances; it wasn’t like Olivia asked for any of this to happen.”

Sorain’s attention was suddenly drawn towards the main entrance, “I think I see them.”

“You think you see them?” groaning sarcastically, Asura said, “Olivia’s the only human on the planet; I think she’d stick out like a third arm.”

As the three of them got up to meet Olivia and D’ana, Sorain said, “Shut up, Asura.”

Olivia couldn’t help but feel a little apprehensive as the three strangers approached. Taking sympathy on her younger sister, D’ana said, “Olivia, let my introduce my brother Narek, his best friend Asura and my best friend Sorain.”

Looking at them, Olivia said, “H-Hi.”
111111111111121111.title: Back on Maltor Prime

1111111111111211111.content:
D’ana watched silently from under a nearby tree as Olivia got acquainted with her group of friends. D’ana wasn’t what the humans would consider a Queen Bee, but she was still the nominal leader of her group. She’d watched for the last 20 minutes as Olivia regaled her friends with stories of Earth.

She was so focused on the scene before her, she did not hear the footsteps coming up behind her. That was until she heard a voice say, “You’re a study in silence, D’ana; you mind telling me what’s wrong?”

Looking over her shoulder, D’ana saw Maiya standing a few feet behind her. Turning away, she said, “You’d think one planet would be enough for her.”

Stepping closer, Maiya knelt next to D’ana, “Your sister?”

For a moment D’ana was surprised that Maiya knew that, “You’d think getting to be raised by my parents would be enough; now she’s coming after my friends?”

“First, it’s not like she had any say in the matter; she wasn’t even born when your parents gave you up.” Pausing, Maiya said, “Secondly; eventually she’s going to be one of us, so she’ll need to make some friends. Besides, weren’t you the one who arranged for them to meet?”

D’ana watched as Asura and Sorain both laughed at something Olivia said. “Yeah, but now I’m wishing I hadn’t.”

Maiya watched as D’ana got to her feet, growing concerned when she saw a familiar look on the younger girl’s face. “D’ana, think this through before you do something rash.”

Ignoring Maiya’s plea, D’ana walked over to the wall where the others were sitting. Seeing her approaching, Olivia said, “Hey sis, what’s up?”

After shoving Olivia to the ground, D’ana climbed over the wall and looked down at her sister, “It wasn’t enough that you got to live my life on Earth; now you’re stealing my friends too?”

Getting back to her feet, Olivia took a few steps back from D’ana as she tried to figure out what was going on, “What are you talking about? I’m not stealing anyone from anybody!”

“Those are my parents just as much as they’re yours.” Her emotions all haywire, D’ana said, “Why should you get to be their favorite daughter simply because you grew up on Earth!”

D’ana wasn’t the only one experiencing emotional distress; the difference was that Olivia was starting to feel ill from it, “I wouldn’t know what it’s like to be the favorite daughter; I’ve spent my entire life living in your shadow.” Stepping towards D’ana while the others looked on, Olivia said, “Until I wound up here, I never thought I’d get a chance to tell my big sister what it was like living up to the hopes and dreams our parents set for her.”

D’ana was caught so off guard by that she couldn’t respond; deep down she wanted to apologize and take back everything she’d said but was too riled up to even consider it. Before she could consider responding, Olivia started to feel all wobblily. Suddenly all the anger D’ana felt was replaced with genuine concern as Olivia collapsed in front of her.

D’ana got to her knees as the others screamed for help, taking Olivia’s hand in hers, “Olivia! Olivia!”
1111111111111211111.title: Conflict with D'ana

11111111111112111112.content:
Helped arrived within seconds; D’ana watched helplessly as they placed Olivia on a stretcher and brought her back inside the building. Her only concern being Olivia’s safety, D’ana ran into the building after them.

It took a few moments for her to arrive on the Intensive Care floor; once inside quickly made her way to Olivia’s room only to be stopped at the door by some guards. “Please, that’s my little sister in there; you have to let me in!”

“I’m sorry ma’am; but protocol states only necessary medical staff are allowed inside.”

****************************


The next 20 minutes passed by excruciatingly slow for D’ana; her every thought focused on Olivia. Oh Chrestus, did I-I do this to her? Eventually the door opened and D’Pkeni stepped out into the hallway. Ready to ask how Olivia was, D’ana stopped when she saw the stern look on her father’s face.

Grabbing his daughter by the arm, D’Pkeni dragged her across the hall to an empty room. Closing the door, he turned and looked at her, “You mind explaining to me why you assaulted Olivia in the courtyard?”

Feeling two-inches tall, D’ana said, “I-I don’t know, everything was a blur.” Sitting on the bed, she said, “One minute I’m sitting under a tree with Maiya, the next I’m looking down on Olivia as she’s lying in the dirt.”

“Maiya said something about you accusing Olivia of stealing your friends. Is that true?”

Everything was starting to come back to D’ana at that point, “Yes sir; I grew jealous of how she got to grow up with our parents on Earth. When I saw her monopolizing my friends, I thought she was going to take them from me.”

“Firstly; you need to realize that Sorain, Asura and your brother would never replace you.” His face turning sad, D’Pkeni said,
“While the Sheppards brought you into this world, they’re not your parents.”

Confused, D’ana looked at her father and said, “What do you mean?”

“They’re not the ones who taught you to walk or talk. They didn’t bandage your knees when you fell off your pedal-mover. They didn’t teach you about growing up and becoming a woman. They certainly didn’t let you cry on their shoulders the first time you got your hearts broken.” Placing a hand on D’ana’s shoulder D’Pkeni said, “You may not be our biological child, but that hasn’t stopped your mother and myself from loving you any less than your brother.”

Embracing her father, D’ana said, “Thanks Dad.”

“You’re welcome, D’ana.” Getting to his feet, D’Pkeni said, “Now before you go check on Olivia, you should know there’s been some developments.”

Concerned, D’ana said, “What’s that supposed to mean?”

“She was under a lot of stress during your fight; stress which appears to have sped up her transformation.”

Hearing that, D’ana rushed across the hall to Olivia’s room; only stopping once she was inside and could see what her father was talking about – the right side of Olivia’s face was completely Maltorian now; her skin was blue and her right eye was now dark blue in color. D’ana also noticed that Olivia’s head was had started to change shape.
11111111111112111112.title: Dana Gets Reprimanded

111111111111121111121.content:
Although she was assured by her father that Olivia was fine, D'ana insisted upon staying with her until she woke up.

An hour passed before Olivia started to wake up, D'ana put her tablet down and walked over to her sister's bedside. Slowly opening her eyes, Olivia turned and saw D'ana standing next to her.

But rather than respond angrily, she said, "Hey, what happened?"

Before either knew what was happening, D'ana embraced Olivia and said, "I so sorry about earlier; I was wrong to accuse you of stealing my friends."

"It's okay." Returning the hug, Olivia said, "I'm sorry for what I said too."

"So you weren't upset about living in my shadow?"

"No, that was true; I just never should've placed that blame on you." Out of nowhere Olivia started blinking, "What's wrong with my eyes? Everything seems different."

"About that." Sitting next to the bed, D'ana said, "It seems stress speeds up the transformation; the right side of your face is now completely blue, your right eye is different and your skull has started to change shape."

Running a hand around her skull, Olivia said, "I see what you mean; my hair must look crazy right now." Looking back at D'ana, Olivia continued, "Would my eye being different have something to do with my vision?"

"Yeah; Maltorian vision is better than humans." Pausing, D'ana said, "Putting it in terms you'll understand, Maltorians see in 4K while humans see in HD."

"Remind me to ask your dad to give me something for headaches." Rubbing her forehead, Olivia said, "I don't think my brain can process two different visual acuities."

"Sure thing, but in the mean time why don't we just hang out for a while just the two of us."

Moving to one side of the bed, Olivia said, "I downloaded some Earth shows on my phone for my hike; you feel like watching them with me?"

Climbing onto the bed, D'ana said, "Sure thing."
111111111111121111121.title: D'ana Stays with Olivia

1111111111111211111211.content:
Olivia and D’ana spent the next couple hours watching the latest Spider-Man movie on her phone. Considering it was probably primitive compared to everything she was used to; Olivia was surprised to see that D’ana seemed to be enjoying the movie.

Once it was finished, Olivia turned to D’ana and said, “So, what did you think?”

“It wasn’t half bad; kind of reminds me of the old holo-shows my Dad used to watch as a kid.” Looking at Olivia, D’ana said, “I will say this though; that actor who played Spider-Man was kind of cute.”

Astonished, Olivia looked at D’ana and said, “Seriously? The two of you aren’t even the same species.”

“Well we used to be.” Turning to Olivia, blushing, D’ana said, “Besides, eventually you won’t even be his species anymore.”

Dropping her phone on her lap, Olivia turned away and stared at the wall. Without even looking at D’ana, she said, “Once I’ll fully Maltorian, what are the chances I won’t find humans attractive anymore?”

“I honestly couldn’t tell you, Olivia.” Trying her best to be understanding, D’ana said, “I mean look at me; I’m a Maltorian and I’m attracted to both species.”

This conversation with D’ana was causing Olivia to think back to earlier in the day; before the unpleasantness between the two girls. D’ana’s brother Narek was only a few months younger than Olivia; the more she got to know him, the more interested in him she became. At the time she’d chalked it up to nervousness caused by meeting new people. But after talking with D’ana, Olivia wondered if perhaps it was something else.

Turning to D’ana, Olivia said, “Hey, I’m not 100% sure about this; but I-I think I might be attracted to your brother.”
1111111111111211111211.title: After the Movie

11111111111112111112111.content:
The fact that D'ana said nothing for almost a minute made Olivia worry that she was upset. Eventually D'ana looked at Olivia and said, "Are you being serious right now?"

"Yeah, I'm being serious." fearing the worst, Olivia said, "If you don't want me acting on it, I'll understand."

"No, it's not that; I'm just surprised is all." Turning back to look at her sister, D'ana said, "Aren't you dating someone on Earth?"

"I was, but that was before he thought I died in that explosion."

D'ana was silent for a moment until she suddenly burst out laughing. She did this for a few moments until she composed herself. Seeing the look on Olivia's face, she said, "I never in a million years would've thought I'd be in a position where my sister tells me she's attracted to my brother."

Olivia chuckled for a moment, "You do realize you're actually not related to him, right?"

D'ana's face turned sad for a moment, "I know, but for the longest time he was my only sibling."

Placing a hand on her sister's shoulder, Olivia said, "Well now you've got three; Narek, me and Eric."

Smiling, D'ana said, "If you want to ask Narek out, you have my blessing." Looking at her sister, she continued, "But I should warn you; eventually you're going to start experiencing puberty."

"I know about puberty, D'ana."

"Maltorian puberty is different than what you're used to; especially for girls." Sighing, D'ana said, "Maltorian females entering puberty undergo a process called val'shalo; where they become sexually aggressive."

"I don't like the sound of that."

"Once a female undergoes val'shalo, they must have sexual relations with a male; or their urges will drive them insane."

Wincing, Olivia said, "I suppose it's good that I'm attracted to your brother."
11111111111112111112111.title: D'ana's Reaction

111111111111121111121111.content:
Olivia was relieved when she was told she was leaving the hospital; it didn't matter if it was on some alien world, she still hated hospitals.

Walking out the entrance with D'ana and her father by her side, Olivia saw all her new friends waiting for her. After thanking each of them for their support, Olivia turned to two adults standing behind Asura.

Going towards them with D'Pkeni, Olivia looked at Asuka and said, "Are these your folks?"

"That's right; Olivia Sheppard, meet Jervix and Talura Telfani."

After shaking their hands, Olivia said, "I don't mean to be rude, but what are they doing here?"

Coming up next to Olivia, D'Pkeni said, "They have agreed to let you stay with them until you can return to Earth."

"Thanks, I guess." Glancing at D'ana, Olivia said, "I was kind of hoping I'd get to say with D'ana; make up for all the time we've missed."

"I can sympathize with that, Olivia; but our laws prohibit having more than 2 children living in one home for an extended period." Trying to be diplomatic, D'Pkeni said, "But don't worry, the Teflani's only live 5 minutes from us; you can see D'ana whenever you want."

Feeling a little better, Olivia said, "How long before I can return to Earth?"

"I'm afraid its going to be at least a week; we have to procure a ship and a crew." Looking at Olivia, D'Pkeni said, "Don't worry; I'm still working on something to slow down your transformation; barring anymore stressful situations, you should still be at least 50% human by time we return to Earth."

We all hung around to talk for a few minutes more, until D'Pkeni and Maiya had to return to work. After saying goodbye to the others, I followed Asura and her parents as they went towards a waiting vehicle.

As we got situated inside, Talura looked at me and said, "We'll generate some clothes for you once we get home, Olivia; no reason for you to wear hospital clothes longer than you have to."

While the shorts and shirt she was wearing for comfortable, far more so than the gown she'd worn up until that point, Olivia was grateful for the thought of getting new clothes.
111111111111121111121111.title: Later on (Leaving the Hospital)

choices: Later on (D'ana and Narek stop by)
1111111111111211111211111.content:
30 minutes had passed since leaving the Medical Center; and the Telfani's hadn't even gotten home yet. While her parents went inside a store, Asura and Olivia stayed in the runabout with the privacy screens up; meaning they could see outside but no one could see inside.

Olivia hadn't spoke much since they left, and Asura was starting to get worried. In an attempt to make conversation, she said, "So D'ana was actually born on Earth, huh?"

"Yeah, she was my parent's first-born; her birth name was Deanna." sighing, Olivia said, "I guess her adopted parents simply made it more Maltorian sounding."

Asura had an innate ability to sense when people were upset, and she could tell Olivia was upset about something. "Is there something on your mind, Olivia?"

Olivia turned to Asura and, with sadness in her voice, said, "Will I have to change my name once I'm Maltorian?"

Realizing the extent of Olivia's sorrow, Asura said, "That's not for me to say, Olivia; that's a decision only you can make."

Turning back to the window as a pregnant m
Maltorian walked by, Olivia said, "I hope I don't have too; I'm named after my grandmother."

Looking at Olivia, Asura said, "If you don't change it, be prepared for some interesting reactions." with a faint chuckle, Asura continued, "Your name is awfully similar to a Maltorian word for intestinal gas."

Olivia just stared at Asura for a moment before she burst out laughing; it wasn't long before Asura followed suit. "Are you being serious right now?"

"I'm afraid so; specifically it means really bad intestinal gas." Chuckling, Asura said, "I had a bad case of ol'iva last week after having some expired neshta juice."

Still laughing, Olivia said, "In that case maybe I will…"

Olivia stopped mid-sentence as she was suddenly overcome by an intense pain in her stomach. As she clutched her side, Asura said, "Hey, are you alright?"

"No, not really." Groaning in pain, Olivia said, "I haven't felt this much pain since I had appendicitis."

Asura was about to run for help when she saw her parents approaching. Stepping outside, she yelled, "Come quick, somethings wrong."

Jervix and Talura ran to the runabout and opened the door to find Olivia lying on her back as she clutched her side. "Oh God this hurts."

Reaching for a device up from, Jervix said, "Q'uris gave me a scanner just in case something like this happened."

Olivia watched as Jervix ran the scanner over her abdomen. She grew concerned when a deep frown appeared on his face, "What's wrong?"

As he showed the results to Talura and Asura, Jervix said, "Your Maltorian physiology seems to be asserting itself." Turning the scanner towards Olivia, he said, "One of your kidneys is being absorbed by the other one."

Olivia hadn't the faintest clue what she was looking at on the screen, but knew enough to realize there was nothing she could do to prevent what was happening. Groaning, she said, "Great, what's next?"

It seemed the Maltorians, or at least Jervix, didn't understand the concept of rhetorical questions. Looking at Olivia, he said, "You'll probably grow a second heart in a matter of days; I can't imagine how painful that is going to be."
1111111111111211111211111.title: Trouble on the Ride Home

11111111111112111112111111.content:
The pain quickly proved too much for Olivia to handle; so Jervix gave her a sedative that knocked her out cold. When she woke up again, she quickly found that she wasn’t in the runabout anymore; instead she was lying on she could only assume was a couch in some unfamiliar room.

Sitting up on the couch, she removed the blanket covering her and saw that she was now wearing an outfit similar in appearance to what Asura had been wearing in the car – a pair of shorts and a vest. Looking around the room, Olivia took notice of how similar it looked to rooms on Earth. Guess not everything has to be futuristic looking.

Olivia was about to call out for help, when Asura stepped into the room, “Well, look whose finally awake.”

Turning so her feet were on the carpeted floor, Olivia said, “How long was I out for?”

“You were out for about 3 hours.” Taking a seat next to Olivia, Asura said, “I was actually starting to get a little worried; but my folks said you just needed to rest.”

Olivia was touched by Asura’s concern, especially since they’d only just met hours earlier. Gesturing down towards her outfit, Olivia said, “Please tell me your father wasn’t the one who dressed me.”

Chuckling, Asura said, “No, that was all me and my mom.”

Getting to her feet, Olivia walked over to a nearby mirror as saw the changes had progressed while she was asleep; half of her face was now blue and it was almost to her left shoulder. Turning back to Asura, Olivia said, “Seems like the changes speed up when I’m asleep; starting to think I should try to stay awake.”

Getting up to join Olivia, Asura said, “D’ana’s father called a little while ago; he was able to synthesize something that would drastically slow the transformation.” Looking at Olivia, Asura said, “He’s coming over in a little while with D’ana and Narek.”

Olivia blushed ever so slightly at the mention of Narek; causing Asura to smile and said, “D’ana told me about your interest in him;
I didn’t believe her until I saw you blushing just now.”

Turning towards Asura, Olivia said, “Are you okay with that? I mean he’s your best friend after all.”

“Yeah, he’s my best friend; but I don’t mind that you’re attracted to him.” Chuckling again, Asura said, “Putting it in words you’ll understand, I play for the other team.”

It took Olivia a moment to realize what Asura meant, “Is that why you were looking at me funny by the lake?”

“I’ll admit that I found you a little attractive; but don’t worry, I knew straightaway that you were straight.”

Smiling, Olivia said, “So what now?”

“How about I give you a tour of the place?”

“Sure, I’d like that.”
11111111111112111112111111.title: At Asura's House

111111111111121111121111111.content:
Asura spent the better part of an hour giving Olivia the Grand Tour; showing her everything from the bathroom with its sonic shower to a matter reclaimer in place of a washer & dryer. If it hadn’t been for the alien technology, Oliva figured this house could have been placed on Earth and no one would have noticed the difference.

Stepping out onto the back porch, Olivia sat next to Asura on a couch overlooking the rather expansive backyard. It was only then that Olivia noticed something she hadn’t before – there were two stars in the sky. Turning to Asura, she said, “How did I not notice there was another star?”

Turning to face me, a smile on her face, Asura said, “You just happened to venture outside when Uzras, the closer of the two, was eclipsing Ekela.” Pointing towards the two stars, Asura said, “They eclipse each other once every 15 days.”

Looking about at Uzras and Ekela, putting a hand up to shield my eyes, I said, “I’m sure that makes for some pretty incredible sights.”

“Once a year our orbit brings us in line with both of them; the result being some pretty intense auroras.”

Sitting back on the couch, Olivia said, “I know I’ll be going back soon; but I really wish my friends could see this.”

Turning back to Olivia, crossing one leg over the other, Asura said, “You’re more than welcome to take as many images as you want; in case you’re worried they won’t believe you.”

“I’m turning into an alien, Asura; they’d have to be pretty dense not to believe me at that point.” Her stomach beginning to growl,
Olivia said, “Changing the subject for a moment; do you have anything for me to drink?”

Getting up from the couch, Asura said, “Sure do, follow me.”

Olivia obliged and followed Asura into the kitchen; watching as she poured a light brown liquid into a glass. Taking it from Asura, Olivia said, “Forgive me, but this doesn’t exactly look very appealing.”

“Just try it, I’m sure you’ll love it.” Smiling, Asura said, “I’m told it tastes similar to an Earth mango.”

Having a fondness for mangos, Olivia took a sip of the liquid and realized Asura was right, “Wow; that does taste good!” downing the rest of it, she said, “What’s it called?”

“It’s called neshta juice.”

Pouring herself another glass, Olivia said, “I could get used to drinking this.”

“I’m afraid you’ll have to; because your Maltorian digestive system will have trouble digesting human foods.” Seeing the look on Olivia’s face, Asura said, “The hits just keeping on coming, don’t they?”

The doorbell rang before Olivia had a chance to respond; she instead followed Asura down the hall to the front door. Once Asura opened the door, Olivia could see D’ana standing there with Narek and Sorain. Upon seeing Narek, Olivia noticed her heart rate increasing – there was something about him that she found irresistible.
