111111111111121111121111111.title: Relaxing Out Back

1111111111111211111211111112.content:
It had been well over an hour since D’ana and the others left; Olivia was upstairs with Asura in her room. The two of them were keeping to themselves when there was a knock at the door, followed by Mrs. Telfani entering, “It’s time for dinner, girls.”

While Olivia was silent on the outside, she was groaning on the inside. In her brief time among them, Olivia had learned Maltorians had some strange customs. The one she couldn’t wrap her head around was that every meal was eaten while naked.

So while Asura stripped off her clothes, Olivia hesitated to do so. She didn’t need a constant reminder that her body was going to look different with each passing meal. Eventually, with some gentle persuading from Asura, Olivia disrobed.

Seeing how the blue was now almost to her waist, Olivia sighed. Coming up behind her, Asura said, “Is something wrong?”

“I-I don’t know, Asura; I can’t help but worry that very soon there will be nothing human left of me.” Gesturing to her feet, she said, “Look at my toes; you can see one of them has already started to shrivel up.”

Placing a hand on Olivia’s shoulder, Asura said, “You’re worrying too much about something you can’t control. I’m sure
D’ana’s father is doing everything he can to slow down the changes.”

Heading to the door, Olivia said, “Yeah, well he better work harder; or it’ll be impossible to prove to anyone on Earth that I am who I say I am.”

Going downstairs, Olivia saw that Asura’s parents were already seated at a table – one similar in design to oriental tables she’d seen on TV. Once they were all seated, the family offered prayers to the Maltorian goddess, Chrestus. The fact that the Maltorians worshiped a female was a pleasant change of pace, since most on Earth worshiped male gods.

What Olivia had trouble with was the Maltorian cuisine; in this case something called penghou, similar in appearance to Earth squid. Olivia didn’t mind that; instead she had trouble with the fact that it was alive, its tentacles exploring her face as she tried eating it. Olivia knew she didn’t have much choice in the matter; especially if what Asura had said about her digestive system proved to be true.

After a few minutes of silence, Mr. Telfani said, “So girls; is there anything new with either of you?”

Without looking up from her plate, Asura said, “Olivia’s infatuated with someone.”

Mrs. Telfani looked at Olivia as the latter shot Asura an angry look, “Is this true, Kitling?”

Sighing, realizing she had no choice, Olivia said, “It’s Narek, one of Asura’s friends; I can’t really explain it but he does something for me.” Absently patting her head, Olivia said, “Is this how that val'shalo starts?”

“That’s not my place, dear.” Pausing, Mrs. Telfani said, “However I might suggest you stop touching your head like that; at least while at the table.”

Confused, Olivia said, “Why’s that?”

“The head is an erogenous zone for Maltorian females.”

Olivia practically sat on her hands. Chrestus, she thought, give me strength.
1111111111111211111211111112.title: Dinner Time

choices: Back on Earth (Olivia's Parents Get a Visitor)
11111111111112111112111111121.content:
Asura and Olivia went back upstairs to their room once dinner was finished. As they both got dressed again, Olivia turned to Asura and said, “Why did you have to tell your folks about my feelings for Narek?”

“Because I didn’t think it would be a problem; Maltorians are pretty open about things like that.” As she put her shirt on, Asura said, “I’m guessing that’s not how things are done on Earth?”

“To a certain extent it is, but I’m actually kind of reserved when it comes to things like that.” Sitting on one of the two beds recessed into the wall, Olivia said, “I’ve been burned before; I told my parents about a crush I had in Middle School and I find out the next day that my Mom told his Mom before I could tell him.”

“Oh, well then I’ll be sure not to do that.” Sitting next to Olivia, Asura said, “I was going to talk with D’ana about it; but I promise I won’t do that now.”

Lying back on the bed, Olivia said, “I suppose its not all bad; I mean now I can ask both you and your mom about what I should
do.” Looking at Asura, Olivia said, “I’m sure you can agree that Narek is rather attractive.”

“I suppose I can see why you’d be interested in him; but don’t forget, I’m not interested in guys.” Turning to Olivia, Asura said,
“The only experience I have in the regard is them flirting with me.”

Olivia suddenly remembered an earlier conversation she’d had with Asura; followed by some peculiar looks she go from her.
Sitting up, she said, “Asura, are you attracted to me?”

Without missing a beat, Asura said, “Yes, very much so; but you’ve made it clear that you’re not, so I won’t act on it.”

The two of them talked for a few minutes more until Mrs. Telfani came in and said it was time for bed. As the got into their respective beds, Olivia said, “Hey Asura, do you what time it is on Earth right now?”

Asura didn’t respond right away, but Olivia heard movement followed by a dull light. Eventually, Asura said, “It’s just after 8:00 in the morning, why?”

Lying back in bed, Olivia said, “Nothing major, I was just wondering.”

As she closed her eyes, Olivia wondered what her friends and family were doing at that moment.
11111111111112111112111111121.title: Time for Bed

111111111111121111121111111212.content:
It was a rainy Saturday morning as Brian stumbled out of bed; the weather outside serving as a perfect backdrop for his hangover. He’d spent most of yesterday evening looking at old photos of Olivia. After taking a quick shower, he walked downstairs to find Gloria sitting at the kitchen table, “Where’s Eric?”

“Kyle and the girls came by a little while ago; they invited Eric to spend the day with them.” Gesturing to the photo albums on the table, she said, “I bet I can figure out what you were doing last night.”

Pouring himself a cup of coffee, Brian sat down and said, “Are we terrible parents, Gloria? We’ve lost two of our three children.”

Taking her husband’s hand in hers, Gloria said, “You can’t compare Deanna’s situation to Olivia’s; had we not sent her away, she wouldn’t have had a normal life here.” Sighing, she said, “I think about her from time to time; wondering what kind of life she’s had for herself – does she have friends, has she experienced love? If it weren’t for what Q’uris and Ma’gi did, Deanna wouldn’t have survived.”

“I guess there’s one ray of hope in all this.” Rummaging through the pile of photos to find what he was looking for, Brian said, “If what my source says is true, and this device is a transportation platform, perhaps Olivia is alive and well on Maltor Prime.”

With the faintest hint of a smile, Grace said, “If that’s true; then a part of me hopes that Olivia and Deanna find each other.”

A smile forming on his face, Brian said, “If they do find each other, I only hope they become close.”
111111111111121111121111111212.title: A Somber Morning on Earth

1111111111112.content:
“…Olivia Sheppard may not return to Earth.”

Having been optimistic the decision would be different, D’Pkeni said, “May I ask why, High Minister?”

“It is our considered opinion that Humanity is simply not ready; either to learn of life beyond their world, or of the origins of our species. Therefore,” sighing, the High Minister said, “since Olivia will be one of us soon enough; she’ll be subject to the same laws as any other Maltorian would. The Council has spoken."

With that, the High Minister and the Council members rose as one and left the chamber; signifying that both the discussion, and the audience, had ended. Healer D'Pkeni remained behind for a moment, his head hung low.

He had, of course, know this could be the outcome; but he had nevertheless hoped the Council would do the right thing and allow Olivia one last visit to Earth – even if it was only to say good bye. Now, though, those hopes were dashed, for all those concerned.

******************************


As D’Pkeni returned to Olivia’s room, he saw that D’ana was still with her. The two of them shared the same hopeful look on their faces, as D’ana stood up, “What did the Council decide, Father?”

D’Pkeni bowed his head; he couldn’t bear to see the hope in their eyes die out, “I’m terribly sorry, Oliva; but the Council has refused your request to return to Earth. It’s their opinion that humans aren't ready yet to know of us."

D'Ana flung herself at him, hugging him while beating his back with her fists. "Why? Why, Father, why?"

D’Pkeni had expected this from his daughter; D’ana was, at times, a very emotional person. However when he realized Olivia wasn’t doing the same, he looked up to see that she was clutching her sheets with both hands. Looking at D’Pkeni, she said, “Co-Could I have some time alone?”

Now D'Pkeni understood; he’d learned, over the years, that many humans preferred privacy when having their emotional displays. Clearly, Olivia was one of these. "Come D'Ana; your mother is no doubt waiting for us.”

Once Olivia was alone, she got up and went to the bathroom to look at her reflection. Her transformation to a Maltorian had continued unabated. Guess there’s no point in slowing the changes anymore. Her right breast was now completely blue, with the skin around the blue showing signs of changing color. How would my boyfriend react, she thought, if he saw me like this?

In a rare fit of anger, Olivia lashed out and pushed the mirror with her first; causing the glass to the shatter and her hand to become all bloody.
1111111111112.title: Olivia Can't Return to Earth
